description: Please refrain from using inline ignore pragmas # hadolint ignore=DLxxxx.
Use absolute WORKDIR.
For some bash commands it makes no sense running them in a Docker container like ssh, vim, shutdown, service, ps, free, top, kill, mount, ifconfig.
Last user should not be root.
Use WORKDIR to switch to a directory.
Do not use sudo as it leads to unpredictable behavior. Use a tool like gosu to enforce root.
Always tag the version of an image explicitly.
Using latest is prone to errors if the image will ever update. Pin the version explicitly to a release tag.
Pin versions in apt-get install.
Delete the apt-get lists after installing something.
Use ADD for extracting archives into an image.
Valid UNIX ports range from 0 to 65535.
Multiple HEALTHCHECK instructions.
Pin versions in pip.
Use the -y switch.
Avoid additional packages by specifying --no-install-recommends.
Pin versions in npm.
Pin versions in apk add. Instead of apk add <package> use apk add <package>=<version>.
Use the --no-cache switch to avoid the need to use --update and remove /var/cache/apk/* when done installing packages.
Use COPY instead of ADD for files and folders.
COPY with more than 2 arguments requires the last argument to end with /
COPY --from should reference a previously defined FROM alias
COPY --from cannot reference its own FROM alias
FROM aliases (stage names) must be unique
Use arguments JSON notation for CMD and ENTRYPOINT arguments
Use only an allowed registry in the FROM image
Do not use apt as it is meant to be an end-user tool, use apt-get or apt-cache instead
Pin versions in gem install. Instead of gem install <gem> use gem install <gem>:<version>
Do not use --platform flag with FROM.
Use the -y switch to avoid manual input yum install -y <package>
yum clean all missing after yum command.
Specify version with yum install -y <package>-<version>
Non-interactive switch missing from zypper command: zypper install -y
Do not use zypper dist-upgrade.
zypper clean missing after zypper use.
Specify version with zypper install -y <package>[=]<version>.
Use the -y switch to avoid manual input dnf install -y <package>
dnf clean all missing after dnf command.
Specify version with dnf install -y <package>-<version>
Avoid cache directory with pip install --no-cache-dir <package>.
ONBUILD, FROM or MAINTAINER triggered from within ONBUILD instruction.
Do not refer to an environment variable within the same ENV statement where it is defined.
COPY to a relative destination without WORKDIR set.
useradd without flag -l and high UID will result in excessively large Image.
wget without flag --progress will result in excessively bloated build logs when downloading larger files.
Invalid Label Key
Label <label> is missing.
Superfluous label(s) present.
Label <label> is empty.
Label <label> is not a valid URL.
Label <label> is not a valid time format - must conform to RFC3339.
Label <label> is not a valid SPDX license identifier.
Label <label> is not a valid git hash.
Label <label> does not conform to semantic versioning.
HEALTHCHECK instruction missing.
Label <label> is not a valid email format - must conform to RFC5322.
Multiple consecutive RUN instructions. Consider consolidation.
yarn cache clean missing after yarn install was run.
Invalid instruction order. Dockerfile must begin with FROM, ARG or comment.
MAINTAINER is deprecated.
Either use Wget or Curl but not both.
Multiple CMD instructions found.
Multiple ENTRYPOINT instructions found.
Use SHELL to change the default shell.
Set the SHELL option -o pipefail before RUN with a pipe in it
$ is not used specially and should therefore be escaped.
This \c will be a regular 'c' in this context.
Remove space after = if trying to assign a value (or for empty string, use var='' ...).
Use semicolon or linefeed before done (or quote to make it literal).
This is a unicode non-breaking space. Delete it and retype as space.
You need a space here
It's not foo &; bar, just foo & bar.
Trying to declare parameters? Don't. Use () and refer to params as $1, $2 etc.
Don't use $ on the left side of assignments.
Don't put spaces around the = in assignments.
For command expansion, the tick should slant left (` vs Â´).
Did you forget to close this double-quoted string?
This is actually an end quote, but due to next char, it looks suspect.
Scripts are case sensitive. Use if, not If.
This {/} is literal. Check expression (missing ;/\n?) or quote it.
Don't use $ on the iterator name in for loops.
Braces are required when expanding arrays, as in ${array[idx]}.
You need a space or linefeed between the function name and body.
Unexpected ==. For assignment, use =. For comparison, use [ .. ] or [[ .. ]].
Quote/escape special characters when using eval, e.g. eval "a=(b)".
You need a space before the #.
Useless cat. Consider cmd < file | .. or cmd file | .. instead.
Note that A && B || C is not if-then-else. C may run when A is true.
This word is outside of quotes. Did you intend to 'nest '"'single quotes'"' instead'?
echo won't expand escape sequences. Consider printf.
Use ./*glob* or -- *glob* so names with dashes won't become options.
In POSIX sh, something is undefined.
Quote this to prevent word splitting
Double quote to prevent globbing and word splitting.
Word is in the form "A"B"C" (B indicated). Did you mean "ABC" or "A\"B\"C"?
var is referenced but not assigned.
Declare and assign separately to avoid masking return values.
Use cd ... || exit in case cd fails.
Specify explicit path for find instead of relying on default behavior to ensure POSIX compliance.
Using set -o with non-POSIX options may cause compatibility issues in different shell implementations.
Avoid piping to commands like rm that don't read stdin; use glob patterns or loops instead.
printf format string contains more variables than passed arguments, which may cause unexpected behavior.
Prevent filename parsing issues by avoiding ls | grep patterns; use glob expansion instead.
Expressions don't expand in single quotes; use double quotes for variable expansion.
Glob ranges must match single characters; rewrite patterns with multiple character ranges appropriately.
ShellCheck cannot follow sourced files; use directives to specify source location or ignore with source=/dev/null.
Shebang must use absolute path to interpreter; use /bin/sh or /usr/bin/env for portability.
Parser error due to incomplete shellcheck directive; correct directive usage required.
Accidental space in deletion path may cause system directory removal; verify paths to prevent catastrophic deletion.
POSIX sh does not support echo flags; prefer printf for portable output formatting.
Critical syntax error detected; mismatched keywords/parentheses that halt script execution.
Prefer $(...) over legacy backticks for command substitution to avoid quoting issues and nesting problems.
Handle filename special characters safely using -print0/-0 with xargs or -exec + with find.
Avoid variables in printf format strings to prevent unintended escape sequence interpretation; use format specifiers.
Terminate -exec properly with quoted ';' or '+' and avoid shell operators; use sh -c for complex logic.
Flag character (-) misused as command; likely missing test brackets or invalid line continuation.
Multiple redirections conflict for same file descriptor; use cat/tee for inputs/outputs or pass filenames directly.
GNU xargs -i is deprecated; migrate to POSIX-standard -I{} for replacement strings.
&> redirection shorthand undefined in POSIX sh; use explicit > file 2>&1 syntax for portability.

Avoid apt-get dist-upgrade to maintain consistent, reproducible builds. Base images should include necessary updates, and dist-upgrade can cause inconsistent dependencies and isolation failures when modifying system components.
Variable appears unused. Verify it or export it.
Consider using { cmd1; cmd2; } >> file instead of individual redirects for performance.
Argument mixes string and array. Use * or separate arguments properly.
Possible Misspelling: Detected unassigned variable with similar named variable existing.
With -p, -m permissions only apply to deepest directory. Set permissions separately on parent dirs.
Redirection lacks command. Attach to command or use 'true' for explicit no-op.
Avoid x-prefix in comparisons (e.g., [ x$var = xval ]) as obsolete practice; modern shells safely handle special characters directly.
Unquoted '=' in command name likely indicates assignment/comparison syntax error; use [ ] for tests or remove quoting for assignments.
Command ending with symbol (apostrophe/bracket/comma) indicates syntax error; typically caused by incorrect quoting or missing whitespace.
Replace non-POSIX expr (length/substr/index) with portable alternatives: ${#var} for length, ${var:offset:len} (bash) or cut (POSIX) for substrings.
Brace expansion {1..5} undefined in POSIX sh; use while/seq loops or explicit list for compatibility with minimal shells like dash.
Use '=' for string comparisons in [ ]; '==' is bashism unsupported in POSIX sh environments like dash.
Special variables (RANDOM/UID/PIPESTATUS) are bashisms; replace with portable alternatives: $(id -u) for UID, $(awk 'BEGIN{srand();print rand()}') for randomness.
